column5: Last minute decision this AM to head on the lake proved to be a great call from Jim Lyon. We launched at 10am and were back at the dock at 330.  We ran 4 lines, 2 copper rigs and 2 boards with snap weights, all with spoons.  With 8 fish in the first hour we knew it was going to be a good day.  We pulled lines after another triple header cleaned our spread and headed in finishing 31/38 on the day. Average was easily 11-12lbs and the biggest was 18.5.  Speed seemed to matter and needed to be 1.7-1.9 on the gps.  Pretty awesome to be fishing open water in January.
Sorry ...i should have mentioned they were all Lakers, we don't get Salmon here in Kingston
I am uploading videos to my channel now, Jim Lyon Fishing. Should be there soon

You need TWO NETS!!!!Â  Or a third guy to be your net man! I would be worried about ice on the launch ramp getting out........ Doug

I have 2 nets but with the RS net i have you can take a hook out in seconds so no issue, i checked the ramp before i went out, oddly enough i did have to break iceÂ Â coming back one day in November,Â  Jan 1st it was wide open. Water temp was 39

I was thinking that a guy handling both the rod and the net looked pretty tricky, and when you had a double header it looked even trickier.Â  Good thing it is a good-sized boat and for the most part each angler could stay clear of the other.Â  (Even if the second guy really needed that net right now.........)Â  ðŸ˜‰ Doug
You sir are right ...it was very tricky and really tiring. hate to say it but we pulled lines 35 minutes before we said we were. we had enough
